result.execSummary:
The defendant Woodrow L Barnes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 11 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Cases 16CM843 & 16CM1080, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied.  Balance of Court Costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment demmed appropriate by Agent.

Anger Management and follow through as deemed appropriate by Agent.
No violent contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes: To be completed within the first year of Probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Woodrow L Barnes in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the charge.
Court find the defendant Guilty of the charge.

Court orders the following:
80 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
Concurrent to:  16CM843 and 16CM1080
11 Days Credit.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  18 Months.
Concurrent to:  16CM843 and 16CM1080
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Anger Management or Anger Management and follow through as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No violent contact with:  vicitim listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.
40 Hours of community service to be completed within first year of probation.

Costs:  $243
DV Surcharge:  $100
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail.
Balance To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
